intro: Vochysia pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered vochysia, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Chrysobalanaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by elongated, woody fruits containing several seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
